1.title: Hello World
1.body:
Let's start off with a simple program that prints "Hello World" to the screen.
Because Java is a class-based language, all code must be contained within a class. Here, we've declared a class named "Main". 
```java 
 public class Main {
```
A file's name must match the class name, so Main.java should be the file name.
All Java programs must have a main method, which executes all code inside it. Which is declared like so.
```java
  public static void main(String[] args) {
```
The given text is printed to the screen using the println() method. You can also notice that code must be contained within the { } brackets, which marks the beginning and end of a block of code. Additionally our one line of code ends with a semicolon which denotes the end of each statement

2.title: Output
